title: Bug 18028: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writable
description: Bug 18028: When renaming a package, the system does not check if all resources within the package are writable, leading to an unexpected exception dialog after finishing the renaming process.
OB:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a package with a compilation unit (CU) in it. 
2. Make the CU read-only. 
3. Try to rename the package. 

Observed Behavior: After finishing the renaming process, an unexpected exception dialog is displayed.
EB: Expected Behavior: The system should include a precondition check to verify if there are any read-only files inside the package before allowing the renaming process.
SR:
Steps to reproduce: 
1. Create a package with a compilation unit (CU) in it. 
2. Set the CU as read-only. 
3. Attempt to rename the package. 

Note: Ensure that the expected behavior is observed after applying the suggested fix.
